thread.title: In new collection, Marin poet Kay Ryan contemplates nuances of loss
thread.title_full: In new collection, Marin poet Kay Ryan contemplates nuances of loss - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Ryan Kost
title: In new collection, Marin poet Kay Ryan contemplates nuances of loss
text:
Photo: Nathaniel Y. Downes, The Chronicle Kay Ryan sits for a portrait on Thursday, Sept. 10, 2015 in Fairfax, Calif. Ryan, winner of a genius award, the Ruth Lily Prize, the Pulitzer Prize for poetry and previous U.S. Poet Laureate, is coming out with a collection of short, witty, playful and incisive poems. Kay Ryan sits for a portrait on Thursday, Sept. 10, 2015 in...
“When you read a poem and it communicates to you, you feel that you half wrote it. You feel part of the making in a way. It’s a wonderful thing. You’re in cahoots. You’re in cahoots with the writer.” Kay Ryan sits for a portrait on Thursday, Sept. 10, 2015 in Fairfax, Calif. Ryan, winner of a genius award, the Ruth Lily Prize, the Pulitzer Prize for poetry and previous U.S. Poet Laureate, is coming out with a collection of short, witty, playful and incisive poems. Kay Ryan sits for a portrait on Thursday, Sept. 10, 2015 in...
“When you read a poem and it communicates to you, you feel that you half wrote it. You feel part of the making in a way. It’s a wonderful thing. You’re in cahoots. You’re in cahoots with the writer.”
